entry.title: George Webster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the CBeebies presenter George Webster (pictured) has "effervescence, bubbly charm, a quick wit", and "an extra chromosome"?

entry.title: Homeric Hymns (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the ancient Homeric Hymns influenced the works of James Joyce, Alfred Hitchcock and Neil Gaiman?

entry.title: Jasprit Bumrah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jasprit Bumrah holds the record for scoring the highest number of runs in a single over in Test cricket?

entry.title: Natives Representative Council (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Natives Representative Council held meetings in school halls?

entry.title: Kenji Tanigaki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kenji Tanigaki, the action director of Rurouni Kenshin and Snake Eyes: G.I. Joe Origins, began his career as a stuntman on the invitation of action choreographer Stephen Tung?

entry.title: a concert (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after presenting a televised singing contest won by Sarah Geronimo, Regine Velasquez co-headlined a concert with her?

entry.title: Qin Huasun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Qin Huasun criticized Taiwan's bid to join the United Nations as a "brazen attempt [...] at splitting a sovereign state"?

entry.title: Green Bay Packers' players selected for all three NFL All-Anniversary Teams (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Don Hutson and Forrest Gregg were the only Green Bay Packers' players selected for all three NFL All-Anniversary Teams?

entry.title: Utter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Utter served as a Stockholm police horse for more than 23 years, participating in 515 changings of the Royal Guards?
